article.title: The Elemental Abundances (with Uncertainties) of the Most Earth-like Planet

multiple_choice_question.text: Which element has the highest abundance in the primitive mantle (PM)?
Looking at the normalized abundances in the lower panel, which data set shows a consistent string of relatively low values for Rare Earth Elements (RLEs)?
Approximately what percentage of the PM mass is accounted for by the 13 most abundant elements?
Which of the following pairs of elements show the largest difference in PM abundance estimates between Lyubetskaya & Korenaga 2007 and the other two data sets?
Which four elements make up the majority (over 90%) of the total PM mass?
What is the approximate percentage of the total PM mass accounted for by only oxygen?
Which element is estimated to be the most abundant light element in the Earth\'s core?
Which of the following data sets suggests the highest concentration of carbon in the core?
Based on the normalized abundance plot, which element shows the largest range of variation in abundance estimates across different literature sources?
Approximately what percentage of the Earth\'s core mass is comprised of only Fe and Ni?
Which of the following light elements is estimated to be the LEAST abundant in the Earth\'s core?
The uncertainty on which two core elements is stated to be non-independent due to the density deficit in the core?
In Figure 5a, which element is the most abundant element plotted on the x-axis due to its nil or extremely low abundance in the core?
In Figure 5b, what is the approximate normalized abundance of refractory lithophile elements?
Which group of elements exhibits a larger range of variation in abundance between PM and bulk Earth: refractory or volatile elements?
Compared to previous estimates, which element shows the most significant negative deviation in abundance in the concordance bulk Earth composition?
For which of the following elements is the concordance bulk Earth abundance higher than ALL previous estimates?
What percentage of literature values fall within the estimated uncertainty band of the concordance bulk Earth abundances?
Which element, among the 15 most abundant, has the highest concordance bulk Earth abundance?
Based on the normalized abundances, which element shows the most significant positive deviation from previous estimates?
What percentage of the total bulk Earth mass is made up of the 15 most abundant elements?
To what element are both PM and bulk Earth abundances normalized in Figure 8?
Which group of elements shows a consistent enrichment in both PM and bulk Earth compared to CI chondrites?
Which element exhibits a significant depletion in the bulk Earth compared to CI chondrites, but not in the PM?
This formula is used to calculate what?
What does this formula represent?
choices: Error propagation for bulk Earth abundance uncertainty
Weighted sum for core element abundance
Unweighted mean for PM element abundance
